title: Electricity Tariff Review Directive
description: ZESCO required to submit application for tariff review to ERB by 30 April 2024 to address cost-reflective pricing and ensure long-term financial sustainability of the utility.
notes: ERB application submitted on 28 April 2024. Tariff decision pending ERB board review.

title: Load Shedding Reduction Plan Directive
description: ZESCO directed to develop and implement a structured load shedding reduction plan targeting a 40% reduction in load curtailment hours by December 2023, with monthly progress reports submitted to ERB.
notes: Load shedding reduced by 22% against a 40% target. Revised reduction plan under development for 2024.

title: Renewable Energy Integration Targets Directive
description: ZESCO directed to develop a 5-year renewable energy integration roadmap targeting 30% contribution from solar and wind sources to the national grid by 2028, in alignment with Zambia's Nationally Determined Contributions under the Paris Agreement.
notes: Renewable energy roadmap submitted to Ministry on 15 September 2023. First solar IPP agreements under negotiation.

title: Smart Metering Infrastructure Rollout Directive
description: ZESCO required to roll out advanced metering infrastructure (AMI) to at least 500,000 customers in Lusaka, Copperbelt, and Central provinces by 31 December 2025, with quarterly progress reporting to ERB.
notes: Procurement process for AMI equipment initiated. Budget allocation of ZMW 450,000,000 approved by ZESCO Board.

title: Rural Electrification Programme Acceleration Directive
description: ZESCO directed to accelerate rural electrification, targeting connection of at least 200 new growth centres per annum under the Rural Electrification Authority (REA) partnership framework, with priority given to health facilities and schools.
notes: Cumulative 412 growth centres connected as at December 2023. On track against 2024 annual target.

title: Energy Sector IFRS Financial Reporting Standards Directive
description: ZESCO required to adopt IFRS-compliant financial reporting and submit audited annual financial statements to ERB within 90 days of financial year-end, commencing with the FY2024 financial statements.
notes: IFRS transition project launched. PricewaterhouseCoopers engaged as external auditors for FY2024 audit.

title: Energy Efficiency and Demand-Side Management Standards
description: ZESCO directed to implement a demand-side management programme targeting a 5% reduction in peak load demand by December 2026, including the introduction of time-of-use tariffs and energy efficiency incentives for large commercial customers.
notes: Directive received. Programme design phase to commence Q2 2025.

title: SOE Portfolio Restructuring and Rationalisation Directive
description: IDC directed to prepare a comprehensive portfolio rationalisation plan identifying underperforming SOE investments for potential divestiture, strategic partnership, or consolidation, with submission to Ministry of Finance by 30 September 2024.
notes: Portfolio rationalisation report submitted to Ministry on 25 September 2024. Awaiting ministerial response.

title: Corporate Governance Code Compliance for Capital Market Participants
description: IDC and its listed subsidiaries directed to achieve full compliance with the SECZAM Corporate Governance Code by 31 December 2023, including board independence requirements, audit committee composition, and remuneration disclosure.
issuingAuthority: Securities and Exchange Commission of Zambia (SECZAM)
notes: Full compliance achieved. SECZAM compliance certificate issued 22 January 2024. Superseded by SEC-DIR-2024-007.

title: Dividend Remittance Policy for State-Owned Enterprises
description: IDC directed to enforce a minimum dividend remittance ratio of 30% of after-tax profits to GRZ shareholders across all profitable SOE subsidiaries, commencing with FY2022 dividends, with reporting to Ministry of Finance by 30 June each year.
notes: FY2022 dividends of ZMW 182,000,000 remitted to GRZ. FY2023 dividend assessment currently underway.

title: ESG Disclosure and Sustainability Reporting Requirements
description: IDC and its subsidiaries required to publish annual ESG sustainability reports aligned with GRI Standards, commencing with the 2024 reporting year, with reports submitted to SECZAM within 120 days of financial year-end.
issuingAuthority: Securities and Exchange Commission of Zambia (SECZAM)
notes: ESG reporting framework adopted. GRI-aligned report for FY2024 in preparation. External assurance provider engaged.

title: Development Finance Investment Portfolio Performance Review
description: IDC directed to commission an independent review of its ZMW 3,500,000,000 investment portfolio by 31 October 2024, assessing returns against development impact objectives and recommending reallocation of underperforming assets.
notes: Independent reviewer Deloitte Zambia appointed. Fieldwork commenced October 2024. Final report expected February 2025.

title: SOE Board Composition and Director Independence Standards
description: IDC directed to ensure that at least 50% of boards of all SECZAM-regulated subsidiaries comprise independent non-executive directors by 31 December 2022, with skills matrices submitted to SECZAM for each board.
issuingAuthority: Securities and Exchange Commission of Zambia (SECZAM)
notes: All subsidiary boards reconstituted by December 2022. Director independence threshold met across portfolio. Directive has since expired.

title: Capital Adequacy Standards for Development Finance Institutions
description: IDC required to maintain a minimum capital adequacy ratio of 15% and submit quarterly capital position reports to the Ministry of Finance, effective Q1 2025, with a corrective action plan required if the ratio falls below 12%.
notes: Current capital adequacy ratio at 16.2%. Q1 2025 report being prepared for Ministry submission.

title: Capital Adequacy Ratio Maintenance and Stress Testing Directive
description: ZANACO required to maintain a minimum Capital Adequacy Ratio (CAR) of 10% at all times, conduct bi-annual stress tests, and submit results to Bank of Zambia within 30 days of each test, with immediate notification required if CAR falls within 2% of the minimum.
notes: CAR at 14.3% as at Q3 2024. Stress test results submitted to BoZ on schedule. No regulatory breach recorded.

title: AML/CFT Programme Enhancement Directive
description: ZANACO directed to enhance its AML/CFT programme including deployment of transaction monitoring software, enhanced customer due diligence for high-risk customers, and filing of all suspicious transaction reports within 3 business days of detection.
notes: AML/CFT system upgrade deployed November 2023. Enhanced CDD and STR procedures in place. STR turnaround time reduced to 1.5 business days.

title: Digital Banking and Mobile Financial Services Expansion Directive
description: ZANACO directed to expand digital banking channels, targeting a 50% increase in mobile and internet banking customers by December 2025, and to submit a digital financial inclusion strategy to Bank of Zambia by 30 June 2024.
notes: Digital inclusion strategy submitted June 2024. Mobile banking customer base increased 28% year-to-date December 2024.

title: Interest Rate Policy Alignment Directive for Commercial Banks
description: ZANACO and other commercial banks directed to align lending rates with the Bank of Zambia Policy Rate and submit quarterly interest rate justification reports to the Ministry of Finance for any lending spread exceeding 10 percentage points over the policy rate.
notes: Quarterly reports submitted as required throughout the directive period. Directive expired 31 December 2024.

title: IFRS 9 Financial Instruments Full Implementation Directive
description: ZANACO required to complete full parallel-run testing of IFRS 9 expected credit loss (ECL) models by 30 June 2023 and transition to full IFRS 9 reporting for FY2023 financial statements, with an ECL model validation report submitted to BoZ.
notes: IFRS 9 fully implemented for FY2023. ECL model validation report submitted to BoZ March 2023. Superseded by ongoing BoZ supervisory requirements.

title: Customer Data Protection and Banking Secrecy Compliance Framework
description: ZANACO directed to implement a comprehensive customer data protection framework compliant with the Data Protection Act No. 3 of 2021, including appointment of a Data Protection Officer, privacy impact assessments for new products, and data breach notification procedures.
notes: Data Protection Officer appointed August 2022. Privacy framework implemented across all business lines. Annual review conducted December 2023.

title: Cybersecurity and Operational Resilience Framework for Banking Institutions
description: ZANACO required to implement the Bank of Zambia Cybersecurity Framework by 31 December 2025, including twice-yearly penetration testing, a documented incident response plan, and submission of a cybersecurity risk assessment to BoZ by 30 June 2025.
notes: Directive received. Cybersecurity steering committee to be convened Q1 2025 to develop implementation roadmap.

title: National Railway Infrastructure Rehabilitation Plan Directive
description: Zambia Railways Limited directed to develop and implement a 3-year track rehabilitation plan for the 1,067 km mainline Livingstone-Kitwe corridor, prioritising sections with operating speed restrictions below 40 km/h, with a capital expenditure commitment of no less than ZMW 1,200,000,000.
notes: 3-year rehabilitation plan approved by Board March 2024. Phase 1 (Livingstone-Mazabuka, 180 km) works commenced June 2024.

title: Railway Safety Audit and Operating Certificate Compliance Directive
description: Zambia Railways Limited directed to complete a comprehensive safety audit of all mainline and branch line operations by 31 October 2023 and rectify all Category A (critical) safety deficiencies within 60 days of audit completion, with monthly safety reports submitted to RTSA.
notes: Safety audit completed October 2023. 7 of 12 Category A deficiencies rectified. Remaining 5 deficiencies in progress with agreed remediation timelines.

title: Passenger and Freight Service Reliability Improvement Targets
description: Zambia Railways Limited directed to achieve passenger train on-time performance of at least 75% and freight train delivery reliability of 80% by December 2024, with monthly performance reports submitted to the Ministry of Transport.
notes: Passenger OTP at 58% as at Q4 2024, below 75% target. Freight reliability at 61%. Recovery plan submitted to Ministry December 2024.

title: Locomotive and Rolling Stock Fleet Renewal Programme
description: Zambia Railways Limited directed to procure a minimum of 15 serviceable mainline locomotives and 200 freight wagons by 31 December 2026, funded through a combination of GRZ equity injection and concessional lending, with a procurement plan submitted to the Ministry by 30 April 2024.
notes: Fleet renewal procurement plan submitted April 2024. Funding structure under negotiation with the African Development Bank.

title: TAZARA Corridor and Dar es Salaam Route Upgrade Directive
description: Zambia Railways Limited directed to develop a joint operational improvement plan with TAZARA for the Kapiri Mposhi-Dar es Salaam corridor, targeting a 30% increase in freight throughput by 2026, with an MoU signed with TAZARA management by 31 July 2024.
notes: MoU with TAZARA signed September 2024. Joint operational task team constituted. Corridor throughput improvement plan under development.

title: Railway Financial Viability and Operational Sustainability Assessment
description: Zambia Railways Limited directed to commission an independent financial viability assessment reviewing revenue streams, cost structure, and subsidy requirements, with a turnaround strategy presented to the Ministry of Transport by 31 March 2023.
notes: Independent assessment completed by KPMG Advisory February 2023. Turnaround strategy approved by Board March 2023. Directive expired; implementation monitored under separate performance agreement.

title: SOE Integrated Financial Reporting Standardisation Framework
description: All major state-owned enterprises directed to adopt the GRZ SOE Integrated Reporting Framework, submitting standardised quarterly performance reports to the Ministry of Finance commencing Q1 2025, enabling consolidated SOE portfolio monitoring across government.
affectedCompanies: ZESCO Limited; IDC; ZANACO; Zambia Railways Limited
notes: Integrated reporting template circulated to all affected SOEs November 2024. Q1 2025 submissions due 30 April 2025.

title: Mine Rehabilitation Fund Replenishment Directive
description: Ministry of Mines and Minerals Development directs ZCCM-IH and portfolio mining companies to conduct independent actuarial reviews of mine rehabilitation fund balances annually, and to top up funds to 100% of current cost estimates within 18 months of any identified shortfall.
issuingAuthority: Ministry of Mines and Minerals Development
affectedCompanies: ZCCM Investments Holdings PLC; Kansanshi Mining PLC; Lumwana Mine; Chibuluma Mines
notes: ZCCM-IH actuarial review scheduled annually. Current fund balance ZMW 3.8 billion assessed adequate. Next review Q3 2025.

title: Copper Royalty Remittance Compliance Directive
description: Zambia Revenue Authority directs all copper-producing companies and royalty-receiving entities including ZCCM-IH to submit monthly royalty reconciliation statements and ensure timely remittance of mineral royalty taxes in accordance with the Mines and Minerals Development Act 2015.
affectedCompanies: ZCCM Investments Holdings PLC; Kansanshi Mining PLC; Lumwana Mine
notes: ZCCM-IH monthly royalty submissions current and compliant. Portfolio mines remitting directly to ZRA. ZCCM-IH provides oversight reporting.

title: Dividend Policy for Listed SOEs Directive
description: Ministry of Finance issues dividend policy guidelines for state-owned enterprises listed on securities exchanges, requiring minimum annual dividend distributions of 40% of after-tax profit to all shareholders including government, and advance notification to Ministry of Finance before AGM dividend resolutions.
notes: ZCCM-IH FY2023 dividend of ZMW 275M represents 22.9% of net profit. Board to consider aligning with 40% guideline from FY2024.

title: Copperbelt Development Levy — Social Investment Directive
description: Copperbelt Province Development Authority and Ministry of Local Government direct mining sector investors including ZCCM-IH to contribute to the Copperbelt Development Levy Fund at a rate of 0.5% of annual dividend income received, supporting provincial infrastructure and community development.
notes: ZCCM-IH FY2024 levy estimated at ZMW 6,200,000. Payment mechanism under discussion with Provincial Development Authority.

title: Beneficial Ownership Transparency Disclosure — Mining Sector
description: Ministry of Commerce, Trade and Industry and the Patents and Companies Registration Agency direct all listed and unlisted mining sector companies to file beneficial ownership registers in the national beneficial ownership database by 31 December 2024, in compliance with the Companies Act 2017 and Zambia's EITI commitments.
issuingAuthority: Ministry of Commerce, Trade and Industry / PACRA
affectedCompanies: ZCCM Investments Holdings PLC; Kansanshi Mining PLC; Lumwana Mine; Chibuluma Mines
notes: ZCCM-IH beneficial ownership register filed with PACRA on 30 September 2024. Government ~77.5% ownership through IDC and direct GRZ holding disclosed.

title: Mercury-Free Gold Processing Directive
description: Ministry of Mines and Minerals Development directs Zambia Gold Company Limited to promote and enforce mercury-free gold processing techniques at all gold buying centres and to support artisanal miners in transitioning to retort and borax-based processing methods by 31 December 2025, in compliance with Zambia's obligations under the Minamata Convention on Mercury.
issuingAuthority: Ministry of Mines and Minerals Development
notes: Mercury-free processing kits distributed to 620 artisanal miners to date. Training programme ongoing. Target of 5,000 miners by December 2025. Annual progress reports submitted to ZEMA and Ministry of Mines.

title: Dividend Remittance and Financial Performance Reporting Directive
description: Ministry of Finance and National Planning directs Zambia Gold Company Limited to remit dividends to the Government of Zambia within 90 days of the AGM dividend resolution, and to submit quarterly management accounts to the Ministry within 30 days of each quarter-end, in compliance with the Public Finance Management Act 2018.
issuingAuthority: Ministry of Finance and National Planning
notes: FY2023 final dividend of ZMW 120,000,000 paid to GRZ on 31 July 2024. Q3 2024 management accounts submitted 31 October 2024. All quarterly submissions to date have been on time.

title: Artisanal Mining Formalisation Expansion Directive
description: Ministry of Mines and Minerals Development directs Zambia Gold Company Limited to expand the artisanal and small-scale mining (ASM) formalisation programme to all gold-producing provinces, register a minimum of 5,000 artisanal miners by December 2026, and submit bi-annual progress reports on formalisation targets.
issuingAuthority: Ministry of Mines and Minerals Development
notes: 1,240 artisanal miners registered as of Q3 2024. 8 new buying centres opened in North-Western and Muchinga Provinces. On track to meet 5,000 target by December 2026 pending budget approvals for Phase 2 formalisation programme.
